posts.post_content: I was stomped by this card in one match of the prerelease tournament. My opponent had equipped him with an [Inquisitor's Flail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inquisitor's Flail), and I simply couldn't draw my second blue mana for [Claustrophobia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Claustrophobia). Skaab's were falling left and right, he was gaining life, it was a bad scene. I was eventually able to smite the ghoul with a [Harvest Pyre](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harvest Pyre), but by then it was too late.

Posted By: Vedalken_Arbiter (10/2/2011 3:06:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Sheoldred, Whispering One](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sheoldred, Whispering One) attacks. [Abattoir Ghoul blocks](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abattoir Ghoul blocks). Abattoir Ghoul deals first strike damage. Kill Sheoldred with [Go for the Throat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Go for the Throat). This is an example of a scenario where Abattoir Ghoul's ability is better than lifegain.  
  
Do mind that normally, lifegain is better because it works when the creature damages players and X/1 creatures. This card is good - and in the Zombie tribe - but he's no [Knight of Meadowgrain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of Meadowgrain).
posts.html:
Sheoldred, Whispering One attacks. Abattoir Ghoul blocks. Abattoir Ghoul deals first strike damage. Kill Sheoldred with Go for the Throat. This is an example of a scenario where Abattoir Ghoul's ability is better than lifegain.

Do mind that normally, lifegain is better because it works when the creature damages players and X/1 creatures. This card is good - and in the Zombie tribe - but he's no Knight of Meadowgrain.
